definitions.definition: To avoid , especially a duty , responsibility , etc.; to stay away from.
To evade an obligation ; to avoid the performance of duty, as by running away .
examples: If you have a job, don't shirk from it by staying off work.

definitions.definition: To procure by petty fraud and trickery ; to obtain by mean solicitation .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To avoid , especially a duty , responsibility , etc.; to stay away from.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To evade an obligation ; to avoid the performance of duty, as by running away .
( transitive ) To procure by petty fraud and trickery ; to obtain by mean solicitation .
